Text: Garfield Gets Real:  It was written by Garfield's creator Jim Davis, who started working on the script in the fall of 1996.
Triplets:<Garfield Gets Real
3:
Text: Garfield Gets Real:  This was the first fully animated Garfield film since the last "Garfield and Friends" TV episode aired in 1995, and the first to be written by Davis since the 1991 television special "Garfield Gets a Life".

<Text: Garfield Gets Real:  Gregg Berger, an actor from the original series, reprises his role of Odie, but Garfield is now voiced by veteran voice actor Frank Welker, since the original actor Lorenzo Music died in 2001 and Jon is voiced by Wally Wingert, as Thom Huge retired that same year.>
